description: Plans to reform social care and House of Lords are trimmed as Keir Starmer’s party opts for caution ahead of vote

title: Tories planning for two back-to-back general elections
description: The Conservatives are preparing for the possibility of a tight election result leading to a second being called quickly afterwards

title: David Cameron is no threat to Rishi Sunak
description: In the latest Sisyphean effort to stabilise his government, Rishi Sunak abandoned his pledge to be the change agent from “the 30-year political status quo” by signing up the man who had been prime minister for seven of those years.

title: Moment TV host quits live on air and declares ‘I’m off to fight Putin’
description: At the end of his news programme Window and Facts, Orest Drymalovsky, 29, told ICTV viewers: ‘That’s all for now. And for me it’s a personal finish today. This was my last broadcast before I am mobilised to the Armed Forces of Ukraine .’

title: What will Stormont return mean for Derry? Sinn Fein and SDLP set out their stall
description: Infrastructure, jobs, university provision and cross border links high on agenda for two largest parties in Derry

title: Crofters and landowners join forces against reform Bill
description: Scotland's crofters and landowners, regularly at odds throughout history, have joined forces in a "landmark alliance" to oppose the Scottish Government's crofting reform Bill. The Scottish Crofting Foundation (SCF) and the Scottish Rural Property and ...

title: New Wales political system poses great danger - Wigley
description: A reform of Wales' political system poses "a very great danger", a former leader of Plaid Cymru has said. Dafydd Wigley was reacting to plans to bring in a so-called closed list PR system for Cardiff Bay from 2026. The plans were approved in principle by the Senedd this week.

title: Childhood sexual abuse survivor Laura Rowe speaks out following NT Supreme Court trial of brother Kent
description: Child sexual abuse survivor Laura Rowe speaks out following the conviction of her brother. She says the justice system needs to be overhauled to make it easier for others to navigate.

title: Government parties' MEPs pick opposing sides in Brussels row with big pharma over drug costs
description: MEPS FROM GOVERNMENT coalition parties have taken opposing sides in a row between Brussels and big pharma over plans to cut the price of medicines by reducing patent protection on new drugs, boosting access to cheaper generic medicines.

title: Argentina's lower chamber approves Milei's reform bill
description: The bill was approved in a vote of 144 in favor and 109 against, moving it to the next stage of voting in the Senate.

title: Renewed calls to pass rail safety reform one year after East Palestine train derailment
description: Shortly after the crash Senators from Ohio and Pennsylvania, both Democrats and Republicans, introduced a new bill to boost safety measures for trains carrying dangerous materials. It would create requirements for detectors that take the temperature of each railcar wheel as it passes. This was an issue in the East Palestine crash.

title: China’s Fujian province steps up defence mobilisation reforms to improve war readiness
description: The southeastern province merged its military-civil fusion office, which is tasked with integrating civilian resources as part of China’s military build-up, with its defence mobilisation department in a structural reform this week, according to the ...

title: Remember the rules, liberals: Only the right gets to mock America
description: “Take a step back, be honest,” Dimon implored Americans without a hint of self-consciousness, during a Jan. 17 interview with CNBC from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. “Trump was kind of right about NATO," he continued, "kind of right about immigration. Tax reform worked.”

title: ‘No-one, especially the Tories, is laughing at us now,’ says Reform leader
description: In an interview with i, the Reform Party leader says his 'medium-term' plan to take the Tories' place as the threat from the right to Labour

title: Woking United Reform Church achieves dream of being solar powered
description: A Woking church has achieved its dream of powering its entire building using electricity generated by the sun, following the installation of 134 solar roof panels and eight large storage batteries.

title: Saving Conservatism: The center must hold
description: As the specter of populism now stretches across the West, it’s diminishing our collective ability to check the advance of authoritarianism.

title: Reform UK admits it accepted a £10,000 donation from Tory donor Crispin Odey who is facing sexual misconduct claims
description: Crispin Odey (left) gave money to Richard Tice's (right) party last August - but Reform initially logged his donation as coming from a city think tank the IIMI.

title: Argentine president's reforms pass first test in Congress
description: Argentine lawmakers took a first step Friday toward approving President Javier Milei's sweeping economic, social and political reform package, which has sparked angry opposition protests.But opposition deputy Leandro Santoro pointed to the economic and social crisis of 2001 as an example of the risks of free-market reforms.

title: Argentina’s lower house votes for Javier Milei’s sweeping reform package

title: China’s Fujian province steps up defence mobilisation reforms in bid to improve war readiness
description: The southeastern province merges departments as part of nationwide push to boost coordination between armed forces and civilians.
